content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function given by <math alttext="f of x equals, e to the x power, times sine x " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mo>⁢</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></math> on the closed interval <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma 2 pi, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mo>]</mo></mrow></math>. On which of the following intervals is <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> increasing?

choices.label: <math alttext="open bracket, pi over 2, comma 3 pi over 2, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>,</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>]</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="open bracket, 3 pi over 4, comma 7 pi over 4, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>,</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>7</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>]</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma pi over 2, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>]</mo></mrow></math> and <math alttext="open bracket, 3 pi over 2, comma 2 pi, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>,</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mo>]</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma 3 pi over 4, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>]</mo></mrow></math> and <math alttext="open bracket, 7 pi over 4, comma 2 pi, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>7</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>,</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mo>]</mo></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma 3 pi over 4, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>]</mo></mrow></math> and <math alttext="open bracket, 7 pi over 4, comma 2 pi, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>7</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>,</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mo>]</mo></mrow></math>

topic.text: 5.3: Determining Intervals on Which a Function Is Increasing or Decreasing

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
